questions.question: 1: What does 'white' refer to in Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN)?

answers.b: The noise power is concentrated at one frequency
answers.c: The noise has equal power across all frequencies
answers.d: The noise only affects white-colored signals

explanations.a: Incorrect. The amplitude of AWGN varies as a Gaussian distribution.
explanations.b: Incorrect. That would be a narrowband noise.
explanations.c: Correct. 'White' implies a flat power spectral density (PSD) over all frequencies. Read more

questions.question: 2: Which statistical distribution characterizes the amplitude of AWGN in time domain?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Uniform distributions are not used for thermal noise modeling.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Poisson is for discrete events like photon counts.
explanations.c: Correct. AWGN follows a Gaussian (normal) distribution in amplitude. See reference
explanations.d: Incorrect. Exponential distribution is used for inter-arrival times in Poisson processes.

questions.question: 3: How does thermal noise in resistors relate to AWGN?

answers.b: It is modeled as AWGN with a flat PSD due to random thermal agitation
answers.c: It has a narrowband PSD centered at 1 kHz

explanations.a: Incorrect. Thermal noise is modeled as stationary Gaussian noise.
explanations.b: Correct. Thermal noise results from random electron motion and has white Gaussian characteristics. More info
explanations.c: Incorrect. The PSD is not centered; it's flat (white).
explanations.d: Incorrect. Noise is inherently random, not periodic.

questions.question: 4: Which of the following best describes the autocorrelation function Rn(τ) of ideal AWGN?

answers.c: A delta function at zero lag

explanations.a: Incorrect. That is for bandlimited or colored noise.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Sinc function corresponds to rectangular PSDs (not infinite).
explanations.c: Correct. AWGN is uncorrelated in time, so its autocorrelation is Rn(τ) = (N0/2) × δ(τ). See explanation
explanations.d: Incorrect. Cosine is periodic, not characteristic of white noise.

questions.question: 5: Why does the power spectral density (PSD) of AWGN appear flat across frequencies?

answers.a: Because it contains harmonics of the input signal
answers.c: Because its autocorrelation is a delta function
answers.d: Because it is sampled at Nyquist rate

explanations.a: Incorrect. AWGN is not harmonic or signal-dependent.
explanations.c: Correct. A delta-function autocorrelation implies a constant (flat) Fourier transform, i.e., flat PSD. See more
explanations.d: Incorrect. Sampling rate affects aliasing, not PSD shape inherently.

questions.question: 6:In a communication system, how does AWGN affect the performance at high SNR levels?

answers.a: It becomes negligible and introduces no bit errors
answers.c: It may still introduce errors due to its unbounded nature
answers.d: It gets filtered out completely at the receiver

explanations.a: Incorrect. Even at high SNR, rare but large deviations from the mean can cause errors.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Inter-symbol interference is caused by channel effects, not AWGN.
explanations.c: Correct. Although rare, the Gaussian distribution's tails are non-zero and can introduce occasional errors. More on Gaussian tails
explanations.d: Incorrect. Filtering reduces bandwidth, but cannot eliminate noise fully.
